snippet: Human rights groups said the detainees’ cases presented questions about whether an earlier ruling giving detainees a right to challenge their imprisonment was being followed.
abstract: Supreme Court refuses to hear appeals from seven men held at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, passing up an opportunity to clarify its last Guantanamo decision in 2008, which gave prisoners there a 'meaningful opportunity' to challenge their detentions in court; human rights groups express disappointment over the Supreme Court's decision.
lead_paragraph: Human rights groups said the detainees’ cases presented questions about whether an earlier ruling giving detainees a right to challenge their imprisonment was being followed.

headline.main: Justices Reject Detainees’ Appeal, Leaving Cloud Over Earlier Guantánamo Ruling
headline.print_headline: Justices Reject Detainees’ Appeal, Leaving Cloud Over Earlier Guantánamo Ruling
